channel.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
channel.description:
I am partnering up with the owner of a youtube channel that has 14k subscribers. My part is to run a website and forums. I know that it'll cost a bit of money for the domain and webhost so I was wondering how google adsense works and if it will bring in enough cash to keep the website up and running.
Every fine detail on what I need to know and maybe some other solutions of making a bit of moolah. This will actually be my first time running a real community so please share everything.

item.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Except if I wanted to host everything I host shared on a VPS, it would run shittier than it does on the shared.

Some sites do fine on shared, and VPS isn’t a silver bullet, most of them run like a steaming pile anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Many/Most shared hosts will require you to have your own IP to do SSL to save them the trouble of doing name-based certificate config.

Personally if you’re gonna go with a shared host my recommendation at the moment would be DreamHost, they’ve kinda won me over over the past year. They have many of the annoyances of all shared hosts but they also have a lot of pluses, their control panel isn’t as shitty as cpanel, they give you ssh access without ridiculous grace periods, the support is knowledable, they’re proactive about monitoring (recently they emailed me to let me know about a script that’d been compromised and used to spam cialis ads on a site I don’t check very often etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:28, topic:417382”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=519936.msg3781018#msg3781018 date=1318469141]

Btw Hostgator vs Godaddy?

I would stay away from both, Hostgator would be the better of two evils. Hostgator was once really good but since they have become “kings of hosting” the support has become irritating.
[/quote]
They are really the only hosts I trust atm. Do you know any others?

Also do you think I should purchase a private SSL and IP?[/quote]
If you want SSL but arn’t selling anything just get a free SSL certificate they are good for forums and such. if you are selling something yes SSL is good to have. as for the IP i don’t know what you mean? as for the hosting no I have no idea I usually used HostGator but have become more and more irritated with the service. Plus I had a friend that worked there that allowed me to get a discount on a dedicated that no longer works with host gator so really no benefit for me to go back.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Although, once you’ve had one site approved, you can just run campaigns wherever you like without further approval. I had a site approved like fuggin 5+ years ago that doesn’t even exist anymore and I just use the same account for everything now.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

TabbyKiller:

Btw is google adsense free?

It is free, but google has to approve your site to be worthy of their ads.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Adsense or other methods?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

AdSense is the program where content providers place ads on their content, and are paid by advertisers (after Google takes a cut).

AdWords is the program advertisers use to place ads on content, which costs money.

Read full topic
